item.title: Automatic Cabin Pressure Controllers (A and B)

numlitem.para: If one outflow valve is inoperative in the manual mode, it must be deactivated closed, with a maximum of two packs used throughout flight, and
Cabin altitude backup sensor system (CPCS BACKUP SENS) is operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Packs 2 and 3 provide conditioned air to forward and aft lower lobe cargo compartments.
If pack 2 is not used, the aft lower lobe cargo compartment may still be heated by the aft cargo heating system.
If pack 3 is not used, the forward lower lobe cargo compartment may still be heated to a limited extent by the equipment cooling exhaust air.
Maximum of two packs used throughout flight.
Carriage of animals and perishables in lower cargo compartments is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard Cabin Pressurization Controller Selector "MODE A INOP or MODE B INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Deactivate left or right outflow valve closed as detailed below:
For the left outflow valve, open and collar the P6 panel CABIN PRESS CONT L ICU and P414 panel CABIN PRESS ICU LEFT circuit breakers.
For the right outflow valve, open and collar the P6 panel CABIN PRESS CONT R ICU and P414 panel CABIN PRESS ICU RIGHT circuit breakers.
Determine position of inoperative outflow valve. If not fully closed, manually close by one of the following methods:
Select manual control for the affected outflow valve (MAN L or MAN R ON), and drive affected outflow valve fully closed.
Deselect manual control (MAN L or MAN R OFF).
If manual control is not available:

note.para: Caution should be taken so as not to lose AC motor shim plate.

numlitem.para: Close valve by applying torque to actuator output shaft.
